mentions.context: GSEA plugin can be used to calculate enrichment for uploaded user-provided data overlays.
In MetaCore, we mapped the list of DEG to the internal map database using the "Pathway maps" option through the "One-click analysis" tab.

Clustering was performed on the T cells using the Seurat package (Hao et al., 2021) in R (Find_neighbors and Find_clusters functions).
Gene expression was quantile normalized using the preprocessCore package (Bostald, 2021).
The macrophage map was constructed as a PD graph on CellDesigner by integrating three maps as a base.

New signalling pathways were identified using IPA and MetaCore and the enriched gene sets from GSEA (Tables 3 and4).
Two proprietary software were used to enrich the maps: IPA and MetaCore (Clarivate) version 22.1 build 70800, both displaying vast map databases.
The initial map was the RA-specific macrophage map from IPA including 44 molecules and 47 interactions associated with PMIDs.
We obtained the global macrophage map by converting the IPA cell and disease-specific map into an SBGN PD compliant map in CellDesigner.

The filtered DEG list was used to identify new pathways using IPA and MetaCore tools described above.

MIRIAM annotations are added through the dedicated section of CellDesigner with the relation "bqbiol: is describedby", which is used to link a component or a reaction to the literature or data that describes it (e.g., PubMed references (PMIDs), DOI, GEO, KEGG identifier).
Two proprietary software were used to enrich the maps: IPA and MetaCore (Clarivate) version 22.1 build 70800, both displaying vast map databases.

Users can also use plugins available in MINERVA, such as the Stream-export, to export parts of the network upstream and downstream of a node.
The filtered DEG list was used to identify new pathways using IPA and MetaCore tools described above.
To expand the Th1 map, we also performed Gene Set Enrichment Analysis (GSEA) using GSEA software (Subramanian et al., 2005), IPA gene sets and the SDY998 gene expression dataset.

To expand the Th1 map, we also performed Gene Set Enrichment Analysis (GSEA) using GSEA software (Subramanian et al., 2005), IPA gene sets and the SDY998 gene expression dataset.

In addition to manual curation of the scientific literature, other sources such as the Ingenuity Pathway Analysis (IPA) (Krämer et al., 2014), DISNOR (Lo Surdo et al., 2018), or KEGG databases were used to obtain RA related information regarding molecular pathways and phenotypic signatures.
The same DEG list was used to enrich the fibroblast map with new signalling pathways using IPA and MetaCore software.
New signalling pathways were identified using IPA and MetaCore and the enriched gene sets from GSEA (Tables 3 and4).
We performed DEA using CXCR3+ CCR7-CCR6-Th1 cluster versus CCR7+ naive cells from RA samples using Seurat and Find_marker_genes function.
The same DEG list was used to enrich the fibroblast map with new signalling pathways using IPA and MetaCore software.
As the second and third macrophage maps were not RA-specific, we used the RA-specific marker gene lists from IPA as an overlay in MINERVA to identify disease-specific molecules and submodules.

All RA-Atlas maps presented in this work are available as online interactive maps on the standalone web server MINERVA (Molecular Interaction NEtwoRks VisuAlization) (Gawron et al., 2016).

In addition to manual curation of the scientific literature, other sources such as the Ingenuity Pathway Analysis (IPA) (Krämer et al., 2014), DISNOR (Lo Surdo et al., 2018), or KEGG databases were used to obtain RA related information regarding molecular pathways and phenotypic signatures.

We obtained the global macrophage map by converting the IPA cell and disease-specific map into an SBGN PD compliant map in CellDesigner.
To expand the Th1 map, we also performed Gene Set Enrichment Analysis (GSEA) using GSEA software (Subramanian et al., 2005), IPA gene sets and the SDY998 gene expression dataset.
The Th1 overlay consists of 523 molecules, including the list of DEG obtained previously, the core enrichment genes from the GSEA (cf.
allowing easy navigation using semantic zoom, cell-specific or experimental data overlay, gene set enrichment analysis, pathway export or drug query.
MINERVA platform allows for visual exploration, analysis and management of molecular networks encoded in systems biology formats, including CellDesigner, SBML and SBGN.

Annotations were added to provide references for all species, reactions, and compartments present in the maps using MIRIAM (Minimal Information Requested In the Annotation of Models) (Novère et al., 2005), a standard for annotating and curating computational models and maps.

Many public repositories such as KEGG (Ogata et al., 1999), Reactome (Gillespie et al., 2022), WikiPathways (Martens et al., 2021), Panther (Mi and Thomas, 2009), and proprietary platforms such as IPA (Krämer et al., 2014) and MetaCore (Clarivate) offer mechanistic insights into a variety of biological processes.

Many public repositories such as KEGG (Ogata et al., 1999), Reactome (Gillespie et al., 2022), WikiPathways (Martens et al., 2021), Panther (Mi and Thomas, 2009), and proprietary platforms such as IPA (Krämer et al., 2014) and MetaCore (Clarivate) offer mechanistic insights into a variety of biological processes.

This initiative aims at fostering collaborations for the creation of disease-specific maps such as The Parkinson's map (Fujita et al., 2014), the AsthmaMap (Mazein, Knowles, et al., 2018), the Atlas of Cancer Signalling Network (Kuperstein et al., 2015), The Atlas of Inflammation Resolution (Serhan et al., 2020), the Cystic Fibrosis Map: CyFi-MAP (Pereira et al., 2021), and more recently, the COVID19 Disease Map (Ostaszewski et al., 2021).
